programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The secret military aircraft constructed by armed forces in America, South Africa, Russia, Australia and Canada that resemble flying saucers, and have caused a stir with the locals.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien therorists investigate evidence suggesting that extraterrestrials have played a pivotal role in the progress of mankind.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Rene pool their resources to get the better of Darrell and Brandon, while Jarrod and Brandi regain their passion for bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds a sweet way to distract the other bidders. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi plan a four-year anniversary party for their Orange Store..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les misses Ashley's presence in the shop, while a man employs menacing tactics to persuade the dealers to buy a couple of outdated computer monitors.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The retailers scrutinise a signature apparently made by deposed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein, and Les loses his cool with a customer over a broken necklace. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator tracks down a woman thought to have the world's loudest voice, and introduces a man capable of astonishing feats of brain power.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The investigation into the discovery of four bodies at a Florida manufacturing plant in December 1997.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams bid on a Reliant Robin and an eco-friendly Toyota Prius as they try to make the most money by scrapping the vehicles.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries, beginning with a rock bearing a cryptic design that was discovered in Roswell, New Mexico, in 2004.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether aliens lie at the heart of Earth's most famous mysteries. In this instalment, he looks at the new clues narrowing down the possible location of Atlantis, suggesting that Plato's mysterious island was the home of an advanced civilisation.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts join the trail of purported Nazi time travel device, Die Glocke, to try and find out if it really did exist and if it could it have been based on alien technology.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether alien encounters influenced the establishing acts of the Founding Fathers as he travels to Washington, DC.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange lights, a government cover-up and something odd above the woods - experts revisit the Swedish Mora UFO photos, Mussolini's UFO files and the Rendlesham forest incident.

programme.title: 50 Years of Star Trek
programme.desc: Cast, crew and fans share their perspectives as we take an insider's look at the highs and lows of Gene Roddenberry's groundbreaking vision of the future, 50 years on from its beginning..

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Actor Zachary Quinto hosts this reboot of the 1970s documentary series that explores the unexplained. He begins with a search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens Tsoukalos investigates whether sightings of the Loch Ness monster could be caused by a disturbance in the space-time continuum.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate why sightings of Bigfoot are so often accompanied by reports of UFOs. Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether the Sasquatch could be an alien living in society's midst.

programme.title: The Great UFO Conspiracy
programme.desc: According to a 2012 survey, more people in the UK believe in the existence of aliens than in God, and more than a quarter of people think that evidence of UFOs has been covered up by the government. In this documentary, writer and comedian Dan Schreiber sets out to track down those behind the current ET conspiracy theories, meeting some of the biggest voices in the UFO community in an attempt to find out why so many people are captivated by extraterrestrial mysteries.

programme.title: Inside Area 51's Secrets
programme.desc: Underground tunnels, hidden enemy aircraft, secret government UFO files... After years of silence, Area 51 insiders spill their secrets for the first time and reveal what's really been going on inside the most secretive place on Earth..

programme.title: Dark Files
programme.desc: A special investigation into the mythologies, conspiracies and accusations that surround an abandoned military base known as Camp Hero in Montauk, Long Island.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at cases where people have claimed that strange voices have urged them to commit horrific deeds, and an analysis of whether they could have been obeying the orders of aliens.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including a challenge involving an egg cup.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Reginald D Hunter and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee, Rhod Gilbert and Ed Byrne join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at pathology, the causal study of disease based on the analysis of bodily fluids. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by comic actor Greg Davies and TV presenter Konnie Huq, while Lee Mack teams up with former cricketer Phil Tufnell and comedian Marcus Brigstocke, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by birdwatcher Bill Oddie and comedians Frank Skinner, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Tom Allen. As usual, the contestants engage in various rounds of topical stand-up and improvisation as they try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Lexy is a 21-year-old with very impressive money-saving abilities, and her deep-set hatred for London's public transport system has brought her to Rebecca and Elo.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Comedians Phill Jupitus and Marcus Brigstocke head to Bolivia for a high-altitude trip, first driving along the infamous 'Road of Death', only to find themselves deep in bandit country. Disorientation takes them by surprise as they have to navigate Salar de Uyuni - a salt lake so vast that Buzz Aldrin could see it from space. Their goal is the ancient mountain city of Potosi, whose silver mines financed the Spanish empire in the 16th century and which is almost 5,000 metres above sea level.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The weird and wonderful compete in an extreme downhill battle in Cincinnati, Ohio, but who will be victorious?.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with longer, more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of Â£3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner introduces a look back at some of the best bits from the series, plus a few hitherto unseen clips. Topics nominated for consignment to oblivion include dabbing, people who love the outdoors and The Archers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Mrs Brown star Brendan O'Carroll, comedian Bob Mortimer and Countdown numbers expert Rachel Riley tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include urinal etiquette, food with bacon wrapped round it and the Essex girl stereotype.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Veteran entertainer Des O'Connor reveals how he doesn't care for birthdays any more, broadcaster Adrian Chiles admits that women's shoes aren't for him and former Radio 1 Chart Show presenter Jameela Jamil isn't too keen on flatmates.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Micky Flanagan, Fiona Bruce, Claudia Winkleman and Steve Jones are first up, with stories including performing a striptease at a lacklustre hen party and saving P Diddy from drowning.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark and comedians Adam Buxton and Rob Beckett are this week's guests.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc, comedian Bob Mortimer, Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Westlife singer Kian Egan are this week's guests, whose stories include licking David Bowie's cake and being ordered to leave town by the police.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The 2018 edition of the series in which teams of amateur racers test out their homemade, gravity-powered soapboxes on obstacle-littered courses in Johannesburg, South Africa. The entrants create vehicles without engines and race downhill in this popular offbeat event.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Joe Lycett, Phil Wang and Ellie Taylor join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at the pastimes of past times. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by comic actor Greg Davies and TV presenter Konnie Huq, while Lee Mack teams up with former cricketer Phil Tufnell and comedian Marcus Brigstocke, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by birdwatcher Bill Oddie and comedians Frank Skinner, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Tom Allen. As usual, the contestants engage in various rounds of topical stand-up and improvisation as they try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including handing an item of clothing to a cyclist.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the East Lancashire Railway, the annual Race the Train event gets under way - with athletes of all abilities taking on the 11-mile course from Bury to Rawtenstall.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look through the corridors of power in 10 of the most opulent and historic royal residences on Earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Lukshmi Villas Palace in India, which was built for the Maharaja of Baroda in 1890 and remains the home of the royal family to this day.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: War Above the Trenches
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about the Royal Flying Corps, recreating the aerial struggle of the First World War based on the personal accounts of pilots.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that 'talk' to bees using electrical signals.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that 'talk' to bees using electrical signals.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A schoolteacher disappears and investigating officer DCI Andy Steemson asks Nikki and Jack to examine evidence found at the house, including traces of blood, bike tracks and a charred cake in the oven. Meanwhile, Thomas is called to the site of the murder of a former drug addict and petty criminal who has been thrown from the top of a flyover, and becomes determined to win justice for the victim in the wake of police indifference - forming an unlikely alliance in the process.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Ajax takes desperate measures to stop Hugh selling the farm, Penny discovers her perfect match thanks to Meryl's dating service, and Matt gets drunk with April.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: When he learns the identity of the new owner, Hugh tries to stop the farm sale, Matt is torn between his feelings for Charlie and April, and Meryl uncovers council corruption.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey spreads her wings for the first time since her husband was put behind bars, and invites a handsome footballer round for dinner. Meanwhile, Sharon discovers the joys of literature. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. The Essex girls steel themselves for a lonely Christmas away from their jailbird husbands. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The police suspect Lovejoy of stealing from one of Jane's old friends, forcing him to enlist the help of refuse collector extraordinaire Brian Nun to clear himself. Unfortunately, matters are complicated by Eric's 'bin diving' habit. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Two mysterious murders appear to be the work of an ancient Mayan curse attached to a statue acquired by Lovejoy. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows
programme.desc: Lavish live-action adaptation of Kenneth Grahame's much-loved children's novel. Matt Lucas stars as Toad, the aristocratic amphibian with a love of fast cars, with Bob Hoskins, Mark Gatiss and Lee Ingleby as his best friends Badger, Rat and Mole, who 'poop-poop' his new hobby when they realise he is becoming a menace to other road-users. However, Mr Toad ignores them, runs away and steals a motor car - for which he gets thrown into prison for 20 years. With no one to look after his stately manor house, the place is overrun with stoats and weasels.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Christmas special of the period drama, which catches up with the nurses and midwives of Nonnatus House in 1962. They receive a letter from a doctor running a mission clinic on the Eastern Cape of South Africa, who is in desperate need of their help to save her urgently needed hospital from closure. The nurses head to Africa to lend a hand, finding the clinic understaffed, underfunded and with a poor water supply, but overwhelmed with patients who need their help more than anyone ever has before. Sinead Cusack guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives return home after their trip to South Africa, to find Nonnatus House has come under new management. The formidable Sister Ursula (Harriet Walter) has taken charge and introduced some drastic changes to the way the clinic is run, which Sister Julienne, bound by her vow of obedience, is powerless to oppose. The midwives come to the aid of a victim of domestic violence whose husband is about to be released from prison, and who risks losing everything if she seeks a divorce. Sister Mary Cynthia suffers further anxiety attacks, and Patsy receives distressing news about her father.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Ursula insists the midwives do not become emotionally involved with their patients, but her harsh new approach proves hard to cope with in the face of two devastating cases. A father-to-be is badly injured in an explosion, leaving him unable to work to support his family, and a couple with dwarfism expecting their first child are warned that their child may be stillborn, a situation that leaves Patsy confronted with one of the hardest decisions of her life.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The government plans to close down small hospitals in favour of larger establishments. Dr Turner and Shelagh prepare for an inspection that will decide the fate of Nonnatus House - but the staff is shocked to find Sister Ursula has no intention of helping to save the maternity home. Barbara comes to the aid of a woman from the Chinese community who is struggling to get on with her mother-in-law, and whose baby is seriously ill.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest and his friends find themselves stranded with a group of hedonists and are desperate to escape, fearful that their lives are in danger. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A student backpacker is found dead in the showers of her hostel, and with a gun in her hand and her body slumped against the only door, all evidence points toward suicide. Humphrey isn't so sure, however, especially when he notices all her toiletries laid out and her towel missing. But when the team question the victim's boyfriend and her fellow backpackers, they find themselves with very little to go on. Meanwhile, JP prepares for the biggest day of his life as his wedding day approaches, and when Humphrey bumps into an old lady friend, Florence encourages her boss to pursue his quest for love.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of 20 year-old Lorna Katz is discovered drifting in the River Lea, with evidence suggesting she was tied up somewhere before she floated downstream. However, the death takes on an ever-more sinister significance when the team discovers that Lorna was the best friend of Ruth Tresize, a teenager who disappeared three years previously, with the missing girl's mother Ali becoming fixated on Nikki for information, convinced that the two incidents are connected.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV presenter Charlotte Hawkins puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Lady Penelope and Parker compete in a desert motor race, and all seems well until the Chaos Crew steals an experimental new engine from the leading vehicle.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: The presenter is joined by comedians Jason Manford, Frank Skinner and Suzi Ruffell, and there is live music from Gabrielle Aplin and Hannah Grace.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.sub-title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: James is joined by Olympic gold medallist and Celebrity MasterChef winner Greg Rutherford, along with chefs Francesco Mazzei and John Williams, and cocktail guru Merlin Griffiths.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John and Lisa cook up some family festive favourites, including glazed ham, a baked Tunworth cheese with onions and potatoes, and mini turkey and ham pies. Plus, Lisa decorates the tree with some beautiful Christmas biscuits.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and Alex Hollywood help to prepare a festive family feast, including Nadia's annual tradition of hot sausage and cheddar rolls for breakfast, ginger gammon with tartiflette for lunch, a recipe for the ultimate turkey dinner, and Alex's delicious alternative to dessert with a white chocolate, raspberry and cranberry brioche for pudding.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet conjures up some ideas for Christmas, including baked party canapes, a brussels sprouts tarte tatin and a spectacular chocolate orange profiteroles tower. Liam Charles pays a visit to serve up Christmas lunch on a sheet of ruff puff pastry and Juliet visits chef Chantelle Nicholson in her London restaurant to sample a vegan main course Christmas meal.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Travellers descend on the sleepy village of Martyr Warren, antagonising local magistrate Hector Bridges, whose subsequent death by shooting brings matters to a head in dramatic fashion. Barnaby and Troy's investigation uncovers the victim has a history with one of the travellers - but revelations that he terrorised his family suggest that the killer may be closer to home.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.sub-title: Take Me Out Emergency Services Special
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents a one-off special of the dating game, hoping to help 30 single women who work in the emergency services find a date on the Isle of Fernandos. Entering the love lift are firefighter John, doctor Iman and paramedic Johnny.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Nigel Havers, Melinda Messenger, Michelle Hardwick and Dave Gorman pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: One of the most enjoyable things for viewers of The Chase is watching Bradley Walsh collapse in a fit of giggles after pronouncing a question wrong, or when a rude-sounding name crops up - or taking a contestant to one side to give them a telling-off if they get too big for their boots. Here, the host presents a second selection of these and other such unscripted moments and out-takes from the teatime quiz show.

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2 (2017)
programme.desc: After saving Xandar from Ronan's wrath, intergalactic outlaws Peter Quill (AKA Star-Lord), Gamora, Drax the Destroyer, Groot and Rocket Raccoon are recognised as heroes. Now, they must fight to stay together as they unravel the mystery surrounding Ego, a man who claims to be Quill's father. Writer/director James Gunn's follow up to his 2014 blockbuster, which reunites Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Karen Gillan and Dave Bautista, with support from Kurt Russell, Sylvester Stallone and Pom Klementieff. Bradley Cooper also provides the voice of Rocket and Vin Diesel is Groot.

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original.

credits.actor: who all appeared in the 1962 original

programme.title: The Strangest UFO Stories of All Time
programme.desc: A look at whether the atomic bomb alerted extra-terrestrial governments to the planet. Are other civilisations now in league with world rulers to control the human imagination?.

programme.title: The Strangest UFO Stories of All Time
programme.desc: Something is apparently hungry for blood in the jungles of Latin America. Many believe it's a blood-sucking alien feasting on goats, cows and even horses.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Andy Parsons and James May, oversees a battle between The Mulberry Tree from Stevenage and The Plough from Battersea.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Strange highway sightings cause drivers to become perturbed, and animals try to claim the position of king of the road. Plus, road rage hits a fever pitch.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of construction disasters, sneaky drivers catching everyone off-guard and oblivious pedestrians causing chaos.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A truck crash sends tons of lemons off a bridge onto pedestrians below, a landslide wrecks homes in Brazil, and a snowmobiler is buried by an avalanche.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a gas leak that triggers a fireball. Plus, a daredevil crashes his all-terrain vehicle during a back-flip, and a pilot-less plane plunges towards a crowd.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bad weather slows down production and Bobby Goodson is angry to see full trailers parked on deck, but his decision to allow Gary Foy to haul his crew's wood may be ill-advised.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The wife of a former US Navy Seal asks the team to restore her husband's 1965 Ford pick-up.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Cornwall for more sheds and more rummaging. On Bodmin Moor, James has accumulated his collection over 25 years, which includes everything from motorbikes to amphibious craft. Can the boys score a deal?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: The boys are back in town and travelling to Redruth, where they're confronted with Roy's sheds and their ramshackle contents. There's everything from a model canary-yellow Lamborghini to Harry Potter's Ford Anglia.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit two amazing sets of sheds in Hampshire, where they find plenty of Japanese bikes - but they come away with a real surprise. Selling their projects on, however, proves to be a challenge.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in the heart of Oxfordshire where they find rare Minis, 1970s Rollers and a pristine rally car - but can they get her running and profitable?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: On the west coast of Cornwall, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove open many sheds in grey, full of classics in all stages of decay. Searching through 50 years of accumulated vintage vehicles, they find the first ever Lotus Elan and a pre-war Sunbeam.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Oxfordshire, where everything the pair look at is oversized and likely over-priced. However, Henry likes a tractor in blue and Sam falls for a Midget racer in a hedge.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their hunt through Britain's sheds, searching for nice little earners to buy, restore and flog for a tidy profit. In Somerset they discover Norton motorbikes, Italian mopeds and French go-karts.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove move on to Hertfordshire, where they find vintage cars, obscure tractors and rare British bikes from the 1950s. It's all going well, but when the haggling starts, things don't turn out quite how anyone expected.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and motorcycle restorer Sam Lovegrove visit the Cotswolds, where they discover sheds full of stationary engines, obscure agricultural implements and some very surprising collections of memorabilia.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove uncover vintage treasures in West Sussex, going behind the scenes at one of Britain's most famous bike shops where, in its dark corners and dusty attics, they find two extraordinary hidden gems.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items languishing in people's homes and use creative thinking and elbow grease to fix them up to turn a profit for their owners. Here they unearth a church pew, create a fish tank from scrap and uncover a special petrol tank.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in East Sussex and Hertfordshire, with finds that include a Victorian egg incubator.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to the West Midlands and London, where finds include a potato oven and an old petrol pump.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a water trough and a cartwheel as they continue their mission to turn unwanted items into hard cash.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien hope a clay pigeon trap, a searchlight and a Peugeot 205 will help make a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to East Sussex in their hunt to discover valuable items 'lost' in people's homes, with their finds including some Victorian street lamps.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners, turning items into hard cash. A butter churn, a slot machine and a set of print trays are among the finds in this edition.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien repurposes some old suitcases, while Henry Cole gives an old dresser some serious bling.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and his long-time friend Tee John set out on a tour of France. In Normandy, Drew falls in love with a grand chateau and in a massive antique fair immerses himself in pop culture.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John enjoy a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they also explore a grand country house.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, who are under constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, who are under constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: How did pictures from the Hubble telescope make the comet of the century look like an alien spacecraft? Has earth already been invaded by alien organisms?.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Baby Has Two Heads: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A baby in India is born with an extra head, doctors operate on a large neck tumour, and a teenager is diagnosed with a rare ageing condition.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2016 car salesman Hufracio Arteaga is found stabbed to death in his Michigan City office. Will surveillance cameras from a nearby building reveal the killer? S5/9/16.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The murders of Tom and Jill Estes. When their bodies were found behind a dumpster in Missouri, police were baffled - until a receipt leads to CCTV of a blood-stained suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three murder investigations involving poison, including arsenic and potassium chloride - one of which requires toxicology tests on frozen tissue from the victim.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists begin work analysing hair and fibre samples found at the scene of the brutal murder of a woman and her two daughters.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Senior investigator Debby MacDonald and her partner find a starving dog in a house that is familiar to the team.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown takes on his most frightening mission ever, rescuing a trapped snake. He also helps an endangered turtle and has a shocking discovery with puppy Tyson.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer fears her father will not approve of her dress, while another bride and her pushy dad try to find the perfect gown.
